The Octopus, a shape-shifter, a soft and moist malleable being, an embodiment of the erotics, a shortsighted sea-creature who knows the world mostly through touching, through muscular intelligence, an embodied cognition which doesnâ€™t necessarily processed directly by the central brain, the feeling of knowing someone by being physically close. response.tagline: Becoming Octopus explores the tactility of the audio-visual, enquiries the differences between fiction and non-fiction, reality and fantasy, subjectivity and objectivity, closeness and distance through personal memories and polyamorous erotic fantasies.
